variant.question: The primary function of a constant speed drive in an AC generating system is to..

options.text: adjust generator RPM in order to compensate for various AC loads during paralleled operation.
drive the generator at a constant speed.
directly maintain a constant proportion between the RPM of engine and generator.
vary the engine RPM to compensate for various AC loads.

variant.question: A constant speed drive (CSD) that has been disconnected in flight

options.text: can be reset in flight using the reset mechanism.
automatically resets in flight providing engine rpm is below a given value.
automatically resets on engine shut-down.
can be reset only on the ground after engine shut-down.

variant.question: The caution warning on the left hand IDG is shown and the temperature does not begin to drop. What can the pilots assume about that IDG?

options.text: That the hydraulic supply is lost, but can be restored.
That the electrical supply is lost and cannot be recovered in flight.
That the electrical supply is lost, but can be restored.
That the hydraulic supply is lost and cannot be recovered in flight.

variant.question: Assuming a constant speed drive (CSD) fault is indicated, the CSD should be disconnected:

options.text: on the ground only.
when the AC generator voltage is outside limits.
at flight idle engine rpm only.
provided the engine is running.

variant.question: A Constant Speed Drive (CSD) of an AC generator may be disconnected in flight. What is/are the typical primary reason for disconnection?

options.text: A slight variation about the normal operating frequency.
Illumination of the CSD disconnect warning light.
An excessive variation of voltage and kVAR.
Low oil pressure and/or high oil temperature of the generator drive.

variant.question: The pilot detectes a low oil pressure in the Integrated Drive Generator (IDG). The pilotâ€¦

options.text: Must reduce thrust on the associated engine and wait for the oil pressure to rise again.
Must pull the corresponding circuit breaker (CB).
Must use the generator control switch.
Must operate IDG disconnect switch.

variant.question:
Which option correctly identifies the reasons, listed below, for disconnecting a constant speed drive (CSD) of an AC generator in flight?

1\. Low oil pressure in the CSD   
2\. Slight variation about the normal operating frequency   
3\. High oil temperature in the CSD   
4\. Excessive variation of voltage and kVAR.
